image.altText: A woman in a red shirt and sunglasses smiles in front of the sea.

props.synopsis: Australian citizen Kira Korolev, an alleged Russian spy, was working as an assistant theatre director in Perth in 2010.

title.children: Alleged Russian spy worked as assistant theatre director in Perth

image.altText: Kira Korolev stands outside the war memorial in Canberra

props.synopsis: Australia's spy agency ASIO was the first authority to investigate concerns about Russian-born Australian citizen Kira Korolev. What followed was close monitoring of the army private and her husband, which has now landed them in custody, facing allegations of spying for their mother country.

title.children: ASIO 'monitored Brisbane couple for period of time' before they were charged over Russian espionage

image.altText: A soldier motions to the camera to move away as a huge truck drives into frame onto a pier off a huge boat

props.synopsis: While it was never touted as a complete solution to the problems of getting humanitarian aid into Gaza, the US has announced its temporary aid pier will be shut down after being plagued with challenges.

title.children: How the US-built pier to get aid into Gaza was supposed to work — and why it didn't

image.altText: Alec Baldwin in a blue suit in front of a cream wall.

props.synopsis: A New Mexico judge has dismissed involuntary manslaughter charges against actor Alec Baldwin over the shooting of Rust cinematographer Halyna Hutchins in 2021.

title.children: Judge dismisses charges against Alec Baldwin over Rust killing

image.altText: Man with beard on motorcycle in rural setting

props.synopsis: John Griffin, who has previously pleaded guilty to manslaughter, "stomped on" his victim with steel capped boots, the South Australian Supreme Court has heard.

title.children: Man 'stomped on' victim before degrading acts on body, court hears

image.altText: Anthony Albanese smiling as an excited voter, a young woman, takes a selfie with him.

props.synopsis: After all the bleak headlines of the past couple of weeks, Albanese's cheery optimism may seem a little weird. But some in the government can't believe they're not "cooked".

title.children: After weeks of bleak headlines, some in the Albanese government can't believe they're not 'cooked'

image.altText: The Robe Obelisk sitting on a large rock with the Southern Ocean and blue sky in the background

props.synopsis: Saving South Australia's iconic Robe Obelisk from worsening coastal erosion could cost $1.5 million, but locals say it's worth the money and effort.

title.children: Million dollar price tag to save iconic 169yo obelisk before it falls into the sea

image.altText: A mother kissing her young son.

props.synopsis: An Adelaide mother who has two months to find somewhere to live with her severely disabled son says she was told to "manifest a home" and use witchcraft or consider living in a tent.

title.children: Public servant advises woman facing homelessness to 'use witchcraft' or 'manifest' home

image.altText: aerial rooftops in inner suburbs

props.synopsis: Australia's property obsession has made us among the richest in the world, but it's also saddled households with enormous debts, and made monetary policy decisions even harder.

title.children: My way or the narrow pathway: Michele Bullock’s property dilemma

image.altText: Leinster shire president Peter Craig leaning on the back of a ute and looking into the camera.

props.synopsis: To some, it was no surprise — perhaps it was even inevitable — that BHP would choose to close its WA nickel mines and smelters. But the decision has left people living and working in nearby towns feeling numb.

title.children: Nickel operation closures leave towns in WA's Goldfields facing uncertain future

image.altText: drak grey skies over a field with wind farms in taralga north of goulburn new south wales

props.synopsis: A rapidly deepening low-pressure system in the Tasman Sea will track towards the coast this weekend, the precursor to a bout of severe winter weather across eastern Australia.

title.children: Intense winter storm to bring heavy rain, gales, bitter cold and snow to eastern Australia

image.altText: Caged hen at Werribee in Victoria

props.synopsis: Farmers and virologists have called for more funding to protect the country's native and commercial birds, with fears the H5 variant could arrive within months.

title.children: Experts warn Australia not investing enough to prepare for 'catastrophic' affects of H5 bird flu variant

image.altText: Two surfers, one lying on his surfboard and other wave jumping on top of a blue-green wave with a modern building behind them.

props.synopsis: The battle for the surf has moved from the ocean to the pool where rival companies are spending tens of millions of dollars to create the perfect artificial wave.

title.children: Are wave parks the answer to 'surf rage'?

image.altText: Black and white photo of school boy smiling. Colour photo of man with grey hair in a suit and tie.

props.synopsis: After a humble upbringing marred by racial prejudice and social disadvantage, Ken Wyatt broke new ground for First Nations Australians wanting to have a say in federal decision-making. This is his story.

title.children: From racial prejudice to political triumph, Ken Wyatt's story is of resilience and leadership

image.altText: Labour party leader Jeremy Corbyn holds his hands out by his side in a gesture while speaking in front of a red backdrop.

props.synopsis: During its time in office, the UK Conservative Party was chaotic, inept and hubristic. But, if it was bad, the Labour Party's infighting might have been even worse.

title.children: It took 14 years, but British Labour was finally elected. What took it so long?

image.altText: A woman with glasses looking serious in front of a yellow wall

props.synopsis: Government data has revealed nearly 50 people have been charged with sexual offences against children in state care in the past two years, prompting SA's child protection watchdog to call on the government to respond more quickly when it suspects a child is at risk of sexual abuse.

title.children: Data reveals nearly 50 people have been charged with sexual offences against children in state care

image.altText: A woman with grey hair wearing a check jacket and pearls

props.synopsis: Commissioner Ann Vanstone, who announced her resignation two days ago, says the state's integrity agency is the weakest in the country, which only benefits "those who are corrupt".

title.children: 'Weakest' ICAC in the nation benefits the corrupt, outgoing SA commissioner says

image.altText: An old woman in pink shirt and cream cardigan sits in between two high school students in school uniform

props.synopsis: An Adelaide program bringing together the old and young has helped participants form unlikely connections. Psychologists say it's helping them socialise, connect and understand each other, and could have mood-boosting effects and lasting health benefits.

title.children: Unlikely friendships between teenagers and older Australians key to happiness in aged care

image.altText: Biden speaks from behind a lectern with american flags behind him

props.synopsis: Joe Biden boasts and blames his way through a high-stakes appearance as questions over whether he should drop out of the upcoming election linger, writes North America correspondent Barbara Miller.

title.children: Vice-President Trump and President Putin of Ukraine — Joe Biden's gaffes keep coming, but he says he's not budging

image.altText: John Setka sitting behind a number of microphones at a Melbourne media conference.

props.synopsis: John Setka has resigned as Victorian CFMEU secretary after 12 years in the role and nearly 40 years as a union official. He has blamed "malicious attacks" from the media for his decision.

title.children: 'Enough is enough': CFMEU boss John Setka steps down, blaming media scrutiny

image.altText: Bobby Hill, Darcy Moore and Isaac Quaynor walk off

props.synopsis: The AFL's reigning premier Collingwood is in danger of following a premiership by missing the finals after being outmuscled at the MCG by Geelong.

title.children: 'Time is running out': Collingwood's premiership defence on thin ice after loss to Geelong in crucial clash

image.altText: A young man wearing camouflaged clothing with a cigarette in his mouth

props.synopsis: Brock Greenwood is the seventh Australian killed in Ukraine. He is one of an unknown number fighting in 'brutal trench warfare' without military experience, an expert says.

title.children: Aussie killed in Ukraine among many 'lulled' to fight war without military training

image.altText: Shelley Duvall stands among a crowd of photographers. She looks over her right shoulder and smiles.

props.synopsis: Shelley Duvall's retreat from Hollywood was a favourite topic among internet sleuths throughout the years. In some of her last interviews, the former star gave insights into her disappearance.

title.children: Why Shelley Duvall disappeared from Hollywood

image.altText: The couple stand holding a koala

props.synopsis: The family of two Australian victims of a suspected murder at a luxury resort in the Philippines have released a statement saying the situation is "like living a nightmare" and they are "praying for answers".

title.children: Philippines police open special investigation into suspected murder of Australian couple as hunt for suspect continues

image.altText: Four large winged aircraft sit on the back of trucks that are driving down a road while on parade

props.synopsis: Officials say the technology will allow them to shoot down unmanned aerial vehicles from the North but not all experts are convinced.

title.children: South Korea says it can shoot down North Korean drones using lasers for $2.15 a shot

image.altText: Paloma Picasso, with shoulder-length brown hair and brown jacket, smiles with closed mouth near large drawing in frame.

props.synopsis: The Picasso estate has contacted Tasmania's Museum of Old and New Art to express its regret about artist Kirsha Kaechele's faked Picasso artworks, but said it considers the matter to be now closed.

title.children: Picasso estate responds to MONA's faked artworks

image.altText: A woman with long hair standing inside a bakery

props.synopsis: Bakery owner Kathryn Ireland says staff and a cleaner were traumatised by a robbery at Yarram in Victoria's east this morning. The robbers were trying to get cash but escaped with nothing but two pies.

title.children: 'All they took was two pies', says Gippsland bakery owner after armed robbers tie up staff in early morning raid

image.altText: Chanel Loren, a black woman, wearing blue, big earrings, short black hair, gazing at camera, blue dress

props.synopsis: Recording artist Chanel Loren was feeling overwhelmed when she penned the track Ebony, which she describes as the audio hug she needed, before she realised it was bigger than just her.

title.children: Chanel Loren's new music could be the audio hug you didn't know you needed

image.altText: Brenden Hall and Madison de Rozario together with the Australian flag.

props.synopsis: Two of Australia's most experienced and well-known Paralympians are honoured, named as joint flag-bearers for the Opening Ceremony of the Paris Games next month.

title.children: Australia names flag-bearers for Paris Paralympics

image.altText: Signs held by three people who's faces are not shown. One signs says 'end racism'.

props.synopsis: Findings in a Human Rights Commission report show governments across all sectors are failing to identify and deal with racism across the country. The country's Race Discrimination Commissioner says there are "systemic failures" in dealing with racism that need to change.

title.children: 'Not good enough': Governments fail on racism against First Nations and culturally diverse people, report finds

image.altText: A court sketch of Brendan Luke Stevens, who has a beard and wears a green shirt.

props.synopsis: Court hears from self-proclaimed leader of religious group and first responder, who says Elizabeth's father was "calm and collected" after the eight-year-old's death.

title.children: Religious group 'well within our rights' to believe God would save Elizabeth Struhs, leader tells court

image.altText: a young boy smiling while sitting on the ground

props.synopsis: Richard Sione angrily interrogated Jason Galleghan before he began a ferocious assault which resulted in the death of the 16-year-old.

title.children: Man who led group of minors in fatal bashing of Sydney teenager jailed for 32 years

image.altText: Gianni Schicchi

props.synopsis: Opera Australia has taken on Giacomo Puccini's rarely-staged (in its entirety) final work, taking the audience to three very different places from the comedic to grimy.

title.children: Three different directors go head to head in unique new production of Puccini's rarely staged final opera
